pr_title: [FLINK-19623][table-planner-blink] Introduce ExecEdge to describe information on input edges for ExecNode

timeline.bodyText: It's better we could use Builder to create an ExecEdge, because all single nodes' priority is always 0, many nodes provide unknown RequiredShuffle, and maybe there are more properties will be added in the future, e.g. source/target node
timeline.author: godfreyhe
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,156 @@

+package org.apache.flink.table.planner.plan.nodes.exec;
+
+/**
+ * The representation of an edge connecting two {@link ExecNode}.
+ */
+public class ExecEdge {
+
+	private final RequiredShuffle requiredShuffle;
+	private final EdgeBehavior edgeBehavior;
+	// the priority of this edge read by the target node
+	// the smaller the integer, the higher the priority
+	// same integer indicates the same priority
+	private final int priority;
+
+	public ExecEdge(RequiredShuffle requiredShuffle, EdgeBehavior edgeBehavior, int priority) {

timeline.bodyText: require keys is not empty here.
timeline.author: godfreyhe

timeline.bodyText: add some comments for the public apis
timeline.author: godfreyhe

timeline.bodyText: provide another constructor private RequiredShuffle(ShuffleType type)
timeline.author: godfreyhe

timeline.bodyText: use ExecNode instead of partition to describe the target
timeline.author: godfreyhe
godfreyhe

replies.bodyText: DamBehavior seems to be a better name. This is an inner class so we do not need to worry that this class might be confused with the DamBehavior in runtime.
replies.author: tsreaper

timeline.message: [FLINK-19623][table-planner-blink] Introduce ExecEdge to describe information on input edges for ExecNode
